title: Marrikkar Mohamed Thahir to fill vacant SJB National List MP seat
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya has decided to nominate Naina Thambi Marrikkar Mohamed Thahir to fill the vacancy created in Parliament following the resignation of Muhammathu Ismail Muththu Muhammathu last week.

title: Resettlement of families and restoration of damaged infrastructure must be treated as national priority – PM Harini
byline: The resettlement of affected families, the provision of essential relief, and the restoration of disaster-damaged infrastructure must be treated as national priorities, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Nearly 390,000 water supply connections yet to be restored
byline: A total of 387,964 domestic water supply connections that were disrupted due to landslides and flooding in recent days, have not been restored thus far.

title: Kaduwela–Battaramulla road which was closed due to flooding reopens
byline: The road from Kaduwela to Battaramulla, which had been closed due to the recent flooding, has been reopened for travel.

title: Showers or thundershowers expected in several provinces after 2pm
byline: Showers or thundershowers may occur at several places in Northern, North-Central and Eastern provinces and in Badulla and Matale districts after 2.00 p.m.

title: Gazette issued declaring 22 districts as national disaster affected areas
byline: A gazette extraordinary has been issued declaring 22 districts as “National Disaster Affected Areas.”

title: Parliament observes one-minute silence in memory of disaster victims
byline: The government and the opposition Members of Parliament observed a minute of silence today to honor those who lost their lives due to adverse weather conditions experienced in the country in recent days.

title: Possibility of infectious disease outbreaks ahead, PHI Union warns
byline: With the ongoing flood situation in several parts of the country, there is a potential risk of an outbreak of infectious diseases in the coming days, the Public Health Inspector’s Union of Sri Lanka has warned.

title: Cabinet approves company to supply LP Gas for Litro Lanka for 2026
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to award the procurement for the supply of 380,000 (+/- 20%) metric tons of Liquid Petroleum (LP) Gas for the twelve-month period commencing in January 2026 to Geo Gas Trading S.A.

title: Apple pledges donations to relief and rebuilding efforts in Sri Lanka
byline: Apple CEO Tim Cook has announced that the company will make donations to relief and rebuilding efforts across several Asian countries including in Sri Lanka that were hit by floods, landslides and strong winds in recent days.

title: India deploys field hospital and over 70-member team for Sri Lanka’s flood operations
byline: An Indian Air Force C-17 transport aircraft has landed in Colombo to support Sri Lanka’s ongoing flood relief operations, India’s External Affairs Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar has confirmed.

title: President to chair Emergency Cabinet meeting today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to chair an emergency Cabinet meeting this afternoon (03).

title: Govt to launch major infrastructure projects at state universities
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to implement major infrastructure projects across state universities in Sri Lanka to improve facilities afforded to university students.

title: Cabinet approves emergency relief measures for Cyclone Ditwah victims
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to provide immediate relief for people affected by the disaster situation caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Damaged communication networks expected to be fully restored by tomorrow
byline: The telephone and internet communication networks disrupted due to the recent disaster are expected to be fully restored by tomorrow (04), the Deputy Minister of Digital Economy, Eranga Weeraratne has stated.

title: Renovation of main Nayaru bridge begins with assistance from Army
byline: Renovation of the main Nayaru bridge in Mullaitivu, which was completely destroyed by recent floods, has commenced with the assistance of Sri Lanka Army personnel.

title: Kaduwela and Athurugiriya interchanges and 150 roads reopened
byline: The Road Development Authority (RDA) has announced that 159 roads, which were obstructed due to the recent disaster caused by heavy rainfall in Sri Lanka, have been reopened.

title: Sri Lanka’s death toll from adverse weather climbs to 474
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country in the past few days has climbed to 474, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed.

title: Atamasthana Chief Prelate advises devotees against traveling to Anuradhapura on Unduvap Poya Day
byline: Devotees from other parts of the country have been requested to refrain from attending religious observances to be held in view of Unduvap Full Moon Poya Day in Anuradhapura tomorrow (04).

title: British Govt reaffirms support for recovery efforts in Sri Lanka
byline: The British Government has reaffirmed its support to the recovery efforts in Sri Lanka following the devastating landslides and floods in recent days.

title: Namal urges Govt to prioritize providing relief to people and restoring religious sites
byline: The government has been urged to provide maximum relief to people affected by the recent floods and landslides and also to give priority to restoring all religious sites, including temples, churches, mosques and Hindu kovils, that were damaged.

title: Rs. 25,000 to be given to each school-going child affected by floods and landslides
byline: A sum of Rs. 25,000 will be disbursed to all school-going children affected by floods and landslides.

title: Act against those insulting ministers on social media under emergency regulations - Dy Minister Watagala
byline: Deputy Minister Sunil Watagala has instructed police to use emergency regulations and act against individuals who engage in defamatory campaigns on social media targeting the President and certain ministers of the government.

title: Pakistan dispatches 200 tons of humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka’s disaster victims
byline: The Prime Minister of Pakistan, Muhammad Shehbaz Sharif, conveyed his heartfelt condolences to the people and Government of Sri Lanka during a telephone conversation with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake last evening (02).

title: 126 damaged water pumping stations restored – Water Board
byline: A total of 156 out of 343 water pumping stations across the country suffered partial or complete damage due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions in Sri Lanka, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has confirmed.

title: Warrant issued for ex-MP Wimal Weerawansa
byline: A warrant has been issued for former Member of Parliament, Wimal Weerawansa, by the Fort Magistrate’s Court due to his failure to appear in connection with a pending case.

title: UK Parliament’s APPG on Sri Lanka to ensure urgent assistance after deadly cyclone
byline: British Member of Parliament and Chair of the All-Party Parliamentary Group (APPG) on Sri Lanka, Andrew Snowden, stated that he met with the Sri Lankan High Commissioner, Nimal Senadheera, to discuss relief and rescue operations following Cyclone ‘Ditwah’.

title: NWSDB assures water quality remains unaffected
byline: The quality of water has not been affected in any way despite the disaster situation in the country, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) stated.

title: Changes need to be made to the budget to respond to current challenges – PM Harini
byline: Certain adjustments have to be made to the budget in order to respond to the present challenges, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Deadline extended for interest-free student loan applications
byline: The application period for the 10th phase of the interest-free student loan scheme has been extended until December 15, according to the Ministry of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education.

title: Nearly 1,500 SLTB bus journeys cancelled due to disaster situation in the country
byline: Nearly 1,500 bus journeys operated by the Sri Lanka Transport Board have been cancelled due to roadblocks caused by the disaster situation resulting from cyclone Ditwah.

title: First disaster relief aircraft from Bangladesh arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: The first consignment of disaster relief aid from Bangladesh arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake this afternoon (03).

title: Disruptions reported in gas distribution to Colombo, Kandy, Badulla and Kegalle
byline: Litro Gas Lanka has confirmed that the distribution of LP gas is taking place to all parts of the island.

title: YouTube says it will comply with Australia’s teen social media ban
byline: Google’s YouTube shared a “disappointing update” to millions of Australian users and content creators on Wednesday, saying it will comply with a world-first teen social media ban by locking out users aged under 16 from their accounts within days.

title: Sri Lanka’s death toll due to Cyclone Ditwah climbs to 479
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country in the past few days caused by Cyclone Ditwah has increased to 479 as of 4:00 p.m. today (03), the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed.

title: Gunman in Modara Devalaya committee chairman’s murder arrested
byline: The individual suspected to be the gunman who recently shot and killed the chairman of the Modara Devalaya Committee in Ambalangoda has been arrested by the Galle District Crime Investigation Division.

title: CID probing 57 misleading rumors circulated during state of emergency – Police
byline: The Police Media Spokesman, ASP F.U. Wootler, declared that stern legal action will be taken against individuals circulating false or misleading information during the state of emergency currently in effect across Sri Lanka.

title: Additional Mahapola allowance for uni students affected by severe weather
byline: The Ministry of Higher Education in Sri Lanka has announced that an additional monthly Mahapola Scholarship allowance will be paid on December 05, 2025, for university students affected by the recent severe weather disaster across the country.

title: 40-year-old injured in shooting in Boralugoda
byline: An individual has sustained injuries in a shooting incident in the Boralugoda area within the Kosgama Police Division this evening (03), police said.

title: Govt launches mechanism to obtain data on industries affected by Cyclone Ditwa
byline: The Ministry of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development has launched a mechanism to collect data on industries affected by Cyclone Ditwa with the objective of supporting their restoration.

title: Two more UAE relief aircraft arrive in Sri Lanka
byline: Two more aircraft carrying humanitarian assistance from the United Arab Emirates (UAE) have arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake this afternoon (3).

title: Netflix hits back at Diddy’s criticism of ‘shameful’ documentary
byline: Netflix has insisted its new documentary about Sean “Diddy” Combs, produced by rapper 50 Cent, is “not a hit piece or an act of retribution”, following criticism from the jailed former hip-hop mogul.

title: Dhamma School exams for Grades 6-10 postponed
byline: The annual Dhamma School examinations for Grades 6 to 10 conducted by the Department of Buddhist Affairs has been postponed until further notice.

title: UNDP Regional Director calls for stronger regional cooperation after Sri Lanka floods
byline: UN Assistant Secretary-General and Director of the Regional Bureau for Asia and the Pacific, United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) Kanni Wignaraja says Sri Lanka, like many other countries, needs to strengthen its infrastructure and preparedness to cope with increasingly severe disasters.

title: Malaysia says search for missing flight MH370 to resume after 11 years
byline: The search for missing Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 will resume on December 30, Malaysia’s transport ministry said on Wednesday, more than a decade after the Beijing-bound flight disappeared in one of the world’s greatest aviation mysteries.

title: 19,000 overseas Sri Lankan workers contribute to ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund
byline: The Management Committee of the ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund, established on the instructions of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to assist the country’s recovery following Cyclone Ditwah, met this morning (03) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: US provides life-saving assistance to Sri Lanka following Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The United States says it is providing $2 million in emergency life-saving assistance for people in need in Sri Lanka in response to the severe impact of Tropical Cyclone Ditwah.
